turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Middle Eastern theatre of World War I.
turn.1: What was the role of the Ottoman Empire in World War I?
turn.2: The Ottomans accepted the Armistice of Mudros with the Allies on 30 October 1918, and signed the Treaty of Sèvres on 10 August 1920 and later the Treaty of Lausanne on 24 July 1923.
turn.3: How did the Ottoman Empire contribute to the war?
turn.4: The Ottoman Empire joined the Central Powers through the secret Ottoman-German Alliance, which was signed on 2 August 1914.
turn.6: The main objective of the Ottoman Empire in the Caucasus was the recovery of its territories that had been lost during the Russo-Turkish War (1877–1878), in particular Artvin, Ardahan, Kars, and the port of Batum.
turn.7: Why were they trying to regain these territories?
turn.8: Success in this region would force the Russians to divert troops from the Polish and Galician fronts.
turn.9: Did they gain any other territories?
turn.10: German advisors with the Ottoman armies supported the campaign for this reason.
turn.11: What else did you find interesting?
turn.12: From an economic perspective, the Ottoman, or rather German, strategic goal was to cut off Russian access to the hydrocarbon resources around the Caspian Sea.
